alert.note: Alert for Banner; Morrill; Scotts Bluff (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 27 at 4:06PM CDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Scotts Bluff, west central Morrill and northeastern Banner Counties through 345 PM MDT... At 305 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Wildcat Hills State Recreation Area, or 16 miles south of Scottsbluff, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... South Bayard Junction and Chimney Rock State Park around 335 PM MDT. Bayard around 340 PM MDT. Moomaws Corner around 345 PM MDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include McGrew and Melbeta. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM MDT for the Panhandle of Nebraska.
